page.title: 05Home Life Stanton-in-Peak
page.content: My Mum's day starts at 7.00am. First she milks the cows, then she wakes me up. She takes me to school in the car. Back home she feeds the calves, cleans out the cow shed and washes down the dairy. When milk has been collected she cleans out the bulk tank. For some of the day she does the housework and bakes or irons. After tea she helps Dad to milk, and feed the calves again, and wash down the dairy. My Dad is a fluor spar miner at Stoney Middleton. When he works early morning shift he gets up at 5.15am. He enjoys farming and loves the animals. He does the walling and hedging, helps mum to milk the cows. I leave for school at 8.30am. My brother, who goes to Lady Manner Comprehensive school Bakewell catches the 8.35am. service bus.
